files.name: qti.xml
files.content:
3 4 4 1

On the worksheet provided or on a separate piece of paper, sketch a graph of a system that meets the conditions below, then, respond to the questions.

The graph of a system of inequalities
  • forms a bounded region
  • has, at most, 1 vertical line as a boundary
  • has, at most, 1 horizontal line as a boundary
  • does not include the x-axis or the y-axis

1. On the worksheet or paper, write inequalities that correspond to the system graphed.

2. Identify a point that is a solution to the system graphed by writing the coordinates of the point.

() ,()

3. Identify a point that is NOT a solution to the system graphed in part 1 by writing the coordinates of the point.

() ,()

title: Graph a system of inequalities given the conditions outlined.
author: New Jersey Department of Education
relatedCurriculum: NJDOE: Model Curriculum: Algebra I: Unit 1: Relationships Between Quantities and Reasoning with Equations

files.name: A1.1.16.ScoreGuide.html
files.content:
Scoring Guide

Q1:: Answers may vary, one possible solution:

Q2:: Answers may vary depending on the graph made for quation 1. The system of inequalities for the graph in part 1 is:

Q3:: Answers vary. The point (3,4) is a solution to the system of inequalities.

Q4:: Answers vary. The point (4,1) is a solution to the system of inequalities.

Score Points

2 points: The student gives a graph that meets all of the conditions, writes a system of inequalities that corresponds to the graph, correctly identifies a point that is a solution of the system, and correctly identifies a point that is NOT a solution of the system.
1 point: The student gives a graph that meets all of the conditions, writes a system of inequalities that corresponds to the graph, but fails to correctly identify a point that is a solution of the system, and fails to correctly identify a point that is NOT a solution of the system.
0 points: The student fails to correctly answer most or all of the question.
